assg3.musiccollection
Class MusicAlbumsCollection

java.lang.Object
  assg3.musiccollection.MusicAlbumsCollection

public class MusicAlbumsCollection
extends java.lang.Object

The MusicAlbumsCollection class is responsible for holding the essential data relating to the instance of its object, as well as providing essential methods to process such data.

Version:
build:2009.04.04-4
Author:

Constructor Detail

MusicAlbumsCollection

public MusicAlbumsCollection()
The MusicAlbumsCollection class default constructor.

MusicAlbumsCollection

public MusicAlbumsCollection(java.lang.String collectionName)
The MusicAlbumsCollection class overloaded constructor method that will accept a String input from the calling method, which will determine the user-friendly name for the album collection object. It will then prompt the user to enter the data for artist name, number of albums by said artist, and number of certified gold albums by said artist. It will continue to do so until the end of the array or when the user enters the specified sentinel values in one of the prompt boxes, which will break the user free from the loop and return to the calling method.

Parameters:
collectionName - This String parameter holds the name of the album collection as determined by the calling method.
Method Detail

getCollectionName

public java.lang.String getCollectionName()
The getCollectionName accessor method that will retrieve the name of the album collection from the instance variable.

Returns:
Returns a String containing the name of the album collection as stored in the instance variable.

getNumberOfArtists

public int getNumberOfArtists()
The getNumberOfArtists accessor method that will retrieve the total number of artists that have been entered into the artists array by the user.

Returns:
Returns an Integer with the sum of artists that have been entered by the user.

setCollectionName

public void setCollectionName(java.lang.String newCollectionName)
The setCollectionName mutator method that will modify the name of the album collection.

Parameters:
newCollectionName - This String parameter will contain the new name that will be entered into the collectionName instance variable. It should be provided by the calling method.

calculateAverageNumAlbums

public double calculateAverageNumAlbums()
The calculateAverageNumAlbums method will be responsible for calculating the average number of albums per artist.

Returns:
Returns a Double value representing the average number of albums per artist as entered by the user.

calculateNumArtistsWithLowerThanAvgNumAlbums

public int calculateNumArtistsWithLowerThanAvgNumAlbums()
The calculateNumArtistsWithLowerThanAvgNumAlbums method will be responsible for calculating the number of artists that have lower than average number of albums in comparison with others in the array.

Returns:
Returns an Integer value representing the sum of artists that have lower than average number of albums.

findArtistWithGoldNum

public java.lang.String findArtistWithGoldNum(int goldScore)
The findArtistWithGoldNum method will be responsible for finding the name of the last artist in the array alphabetically that has a number of certified gold albums equivalent to goldScore, which is a parameter provided by the calling method. If none are found then "noartist" is returned.

Parameters:
goldScore - This Integer parameter holds the number of gold albums to which this method must match an artist name to.
Returns:
Returns a String that will contain the name of the artist which has the matching amount of gold albums.

findNumAlbumsOfArtist

public int findNumAlbumsOfArtist(java.lang.String artistName)
The findNumAlbumsOfArtist method will be responsible for finding the number of albums by artistName, which is the parameter provided by the calling method. If none are found, then this method will return '9999'.

Parameters:
artistName - This String parameter holds the name of the artist, which this method must find the number of albums by.
Returns:
Returns an Integer value that will contain the number of albums by artistName.
